ca.uqac.lif.textidote.as

Class AnnotatedString

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.textidote.as.AnnotatedString

  • public class AnnotatedString
extends java.lang.Object

    A multi-line character string that keeps references to portions of another piece of text.

    • Field Summary

      • append

        public AnnotatedString append(java.lang.String s,
                              Range r)

        Appends a new string to the current annotated string, at the current position on the current line; keeps an association to a range of characters in the external text file.

        Parameters:
        s - The string to append
        r - The range in the external text file from which the characters in s come
        Returns:
        This annotated string

      • append

        public AnnotatedString append(java.lang.String s)

        Appends a new string to the current annotated string, at the current position on the current line.

        Parameters:
        s - The string to append
        Returns:
        This annotated string

      • appendNewLine

        public AnnotatedString appendNewLine()

        Appends a new line to this string

        Returns:
        This annotated string

      • append

        public AnnotatedString append(AnnotatedString as)

        Appends an annotated string to the current one. If the annotated string passed as an argument has associations, these associations will be transferred to the current annotated string, by offsetting their positions relative to the current position in the current string.

        Parameters:
        as - The annotated string to append
        Returns:
        This annotated string

      • getLines

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLines()

        Gets the list of text lines in the current string

        Returns:
        The list of lines

        protected Range findKeyRangeFor(Position p)

        Retrieves the range in the map’s keys that contains the given position

        Parameters:
        p - The position
        Returns:
        The range, if null if no range contains this position

      • findKeyRangeForValue

        protected Range findKeyRangeForValue(Position p)

        Retrieves the range in the map’s keys, whose corresponding value contains the given position

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The range, if null if no range contains this position

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:

      • substring

        public AnnotatedString substring(Range r)

        Returns a substring of the current annotated string.

        Parameters:
        r - The range representing the part of the current string to keep.
        Returns:
        The substring. All references to the external text file are preserved (and their positions shifted accordingly) in the output string.

      • substring

        public AnnotatedString substring(Position start,
                                 Position end)

        Returns a substring of the current annotated string.

        Parameters:
        start - The start position of the portion of the current string to keep
        end - The end position of the portion of the current string to keep
        Returns:
        The substring. All references to the external text file are preserved (and their positions shifted accordingly) in the output string.

      • substring

        public AnnotatedString substring(Position start)

        Returns a substring of the current annotated string.

        Parameters:
        start - The start position of the portion of the current string to keep
        Returns:
        The substring, from the start position to the very end of the string

      • length

        public int length()

        Gets the length of the string, in number of characters. If the string contains multiple lines, this also counts the length of the new line delimiter at the end of each line except the last.

        Returns:
        The length of the string

      • find

        public Match find(java.lang.String regex,
                  Position start)

        Attempts to match a regular expression to this string.

        Parameters:
        regex - The regex to find. The pattern must not span multiple lines.
        start - The start position
        Returns:
        A match, or null if the string cannot be found or the position is outside the boundaries of the string

      • find

        public Match find(java.lang.String regex)

        Attempts to match a regular expression to this string.

        Parameters:
        regex - The string to find. The pattern must not span multiple lines.
        Returns:
        A match, or null if the string cannot be found

      • replace

        public AnnotatedString replace(java.lang.String regex,
                               java.lang.String to,
                               Position start)

        Replaces a pattern by another in the string.

        Parameters:
        regex - The pattern to find. The pattern must not span multiple lines.
        to - The string to replace it with. It must not span multiple lines. If the replacement contains occurrences of capture groups, and those capture groups were linked to character ranges in the external text file, this link will be lost in the resulting string.
        start - The position where to start searching
        Returns:
        A new instance of annotated string with the replacement being made.

      • replace

        public AnnotatedString replace(java.lang.String regex,
                               java.lang.String to)

      • replaceAll

        public AnnotatedString replaceAll(java.lang.String regex,
                                  java.lang.String to)

      • lineCount

        public int lineCount()

        Gets the number of lines in this string

        Returns:
        The number of lines

      • getLine

        public java.lang.String getLine(int line_nb)

        Gets the n-th line of the string

        Parameters:
        line_nb - The number of the line
        Returns:
        The line; an exception if thrown if the argument is out of bounds

      • getPosition

        public Position getPosition(int nb_chars)

        Computes the position (line/column) of the n-th character in the string. If the string contains multiple lines, the size of each line separator is also included in the count.

        Parameters:
        nb_chars - The number of characters from the beginning of the string
        Returns:
        The position; you get Position.NOWHERE if nb_chars lies beyond the string boundaries

      • removeLine

        public AnnotatedString removeLine(int line_nb)

        Removes a complete line from the string.

        Parameters:
        line_nb - The line number
        Returns:
        This string

      • resizeSourceRange

        protected static Range resizeSourceRange(Range orig_key_range,
                                         Range resized_key_range,
                                         Range orig_source_range)

        Resizes a source range, by mirrorring the resizing done to the key range after an intersection

        Parameters:
        orig_key_range - The original key range
        resized_key_range - The resized key range
        orig_source_range - The original source range (the one to be resized)
        Returns:
        The resized source range

      • trimFrom

        public AnnotatedString trimFrom(Position pos)

        Trims a line of the string from a given position

        Parameters:
        pos - The position. All characters on the same line, starting from this position on to the end of the string, will be removed.
        Returns:
        A new string trimmed accordingly

      • read

        public static AnnotatedString read(java.util.Scanner scanner)

        Creates an annotated string from a scanner

        Parameters:
        scanner - The scanner
        Returns:
        The annotated string

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()

        Determines if the string is empty, i.e. contains no characters.

        Returns:
        true if the string is empty, false otherwise
